t: To the Chief Musician. With stringed instruments. A Psalm of David.
Hear*pn me when I call, O God of my righteousness! You*ld have relieved me in my*i distress; Have*ld mercy on me, and hear my prayer.
How*ln long, O you sons of men, Will*ild you*i turn*i my glory to shame? How*ild long*i will you love worthlessness And*ild seek falsehood? Selah*ipg
But*ld know that the Lord*s has set apart for Himself him who is godly; The*ld Lord*s will hear when I call to Him.
Be*ln angry, and do not sin. Meditate*ld within your heart on your bed, and be still. Selah*ipg
Offer*ld the sacrifices of righteousness, And*ld put your trust in the Lord.*s
There*iln are*i many who say, “Who*ld will show us any*i good?” Lord,*sld lift up the light of Your countenance upon us.
You*ld have put gladness in my heart, More*ld than in the season that their grain and wine increased.
I*ld will both lie down in peace, and sleep; For*ld You alone, O Lord,*s make me dwell in safety.
